sentences.en: A report by the state prosecutor described the police action as confused and disorganised.
sentences.cn: 州检察官的报告称警方的这次行动混乱无序、毫无章法。

sentences.en: A true class performance was turned in by ex - federal and state prosecutor Richard Thornburgh.
sentences.cn: 真正做出一流成绩的是联邦和州的前任检查官理查德?索恩伯格.

sentences.en: His chances do not seem good in view of the fact that the Chief Prosecutor has already voiced his public disapproval.
sentences.cn: 鉴于检察长已公开表示反对，他的机会看来不大了。

sentences.en: I was the first to go before the prosecutor.
sentences.cn: 我是第一个被带到检察官面前的人。

sentences.en: Mo - Astoria is on the prosecutor said, is one of complete manipulation.
sentences.cn: 莫道夫 则对检察官称, 完全是其一人操纵.

sentences.en: Nevertheless, Acting Attorney General Bork followed President Nixon's directive to dismiss the prosecutor without cause.
sentences.cn: 但代理司法部长博克遵照总统尼克松的指示,无理由地解雇了检查官.

sentences.en: She was a sort of policewoman-cum-prosecutor.
sentences.cn: 她可以说是警察兼检察官。

sentences.en: The defender argued down the prosecutor at the court.
sentences.cn: 辩护人在法庭上驳倒了起诉人.

sentences.en: The prosecutor accused the defendant of fraud.
sentences.cn: 原告控告被告犯有欺诈罪.

sentences.en: The prosecutor decided to pursue the case to the end.
sentences.cn: 检察官决定对此案穷追不舍.

sentences.en: The prosecutor had an ace in the hole: an eyewitness.
sentences.cn: 检举人有秘密武器(神秘王牌): 目击者.

sentences.en: The prosecutor indicted him of nuisance.
sentences.cn: 原告指控他非法妨害他人.

sentences.en: The prosecutor started a probe to investigate possible police abuse.
sentences.cn: 检察官开始深入调查警员可能滥用职权一案.

sentences.en: The prosecutor would tear your testimony to pieces.
sentences.cn: 检查官会把你的证言驳得体无完肤.

sentences.en: The public prosecutor charged treason against the prisoner.
sentences.cn: 检察官指控该罪犯叛国.

sentences.en: To this effect , in as few or fewer words, the Public Prosecutor.
sentences.cn: 公众检察官的发言极简短,大意如此.

words.tran_cn: 检举；贯彻；从事；依法进行
检察官；[法]公诉人；起诉人；实行者

phrases.tran_cn: 首席检察官，主任检察官；检察长

trans.tran_cn: 公诉人，检察官，原告律师
trans.tran_en: In some countries, a prosecutor is a lawyer or official who brings charges against someone or tries to prove in a trial that they are guilty
